Package oogasalad.editor.view

Class DynamicVariableDialog

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.control.Dialog<DynamicVariable>
oogasalad.editor.view.DynamicVariableDialog
All Implemented Interfaces:
EventTarget
public class DynamicVariableDialog extends Dialog<DynamicVariable>
A custom JavaFX Dialog for creating new DynamicVariable instances.

  • Method Details

    • setupDialogPane

      private void setupDialogPane()
      Sets up the dialog pane including styling, buttons, and field references.

    • createDynamicVariableDialogGrid

      private GridPane createDynamicVariableDialogGrid()
      Creates and returns the GridPane layout used in the dialog.
      Returns:
      GridPane containing input fields and labels

    • setupValidationBinding

      private void setupValidationBinding()
      Binds validation logic to the input fields to control the enabled state of the Add button.

    • setupResultConverter

      private void setupResultConverter()
      Configures how the dialog result is constructed based on button input.

    • createVariableFromInput

      private DynamicVariable createVariableFromInput()
      Attempts to create a DynamicVariable from the current state of the input fields.
      Returns:
      The created DynamicVariable.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if any required input field reference is unexpectedly null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if variable creation fails due to invalid data format (empty required fields).
      NullPointerException - if typeComboBox.getValue() returns null.

    • validateVariableInputs

      private void validateVariableInputs(String name, String type, String value)
      Validates the essential inputs for creating a DynamicVariable. Throws appropriate exceptions if validation fails.
      Parameters:
      name - The variable name.
      type - The selected variable type.
      value - The initial variable value.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if name or value is empty.
      NullPointerException - if type is null.

    • showErrorAlert

      private void showErrorAlert(String title, String contentText)
      Displays an error alert to the user.
      Parameters:
      title - the title of the alert window
      contentText - the main error message
